content.description:
Improbe Amor, quid non mortalia pectora cogis!

Ire iterum in lacrimas, iterum temptare precando

cogitur et supplex animos summittere* amori

ne quid inexpertum frustra moritura relinquat.

*also appears as submittere in some texts
content.question: Name one figure of speech that appears in line 1 and write out the Latin words in which the figure is found.

frqParts.text: Name one figure of speech that appears in line 1 and write out the Latin words in which the figure is found.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
